intro: Strobilanthes sessilis var. sessilis, commonly known as the sessile strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
